1.text: Roll the pomegranate on your cutting board to loosen the seeds.

2.text: Position your pomegranate in the middle of the cutting board.

3.text: Cut the top (flower) off of the pomegranate.

4.text: Slice the pomegranate in half, along the ridges.

5.text: Cut each of the ridges to create 5 slices for easy eating.

6.text: Tear the pomegranate apart if you just want to remove the seeds.

7.text: Roll your pomegranate on the cutting board to loosen the seeds.

8.text: Put your pomegranate on its side on a cutting board.

9.text: Make 3 shallow slices down the middle, at the top, and at the bottom.

10.text: Tear or cut off the top and bottom of the fruit.

11.text: Turn the pomegranate so the cut sides face out, then slice again.

12.text: Roll the pomegranate to the other side, then make a shallow cut.

13.text: Use your thumbs to pull the pomegranate apart.

14.text: Fill a large bowl with fresh, cool water.

15.text: Make a shallow cut down the side of your pomegranate.

16.text: Use your thumbs to tear the pomegranate into 2 halves.

17.text: Place the 2 halves in the water.

18.text: Use your fingers to nudge the seeds free, if they're stuck.

19.text: Strain the pomegranate seeds into a bowl.

20.text: Make a shallow slice in the side of your pomegranate.

21.text: Use your thumbs to pull your pomegranate into 2 halves.

22.text: Place one half, seed side down, over a bowl.

23.text: Hit the skin of the pomegranate with a wooden spoon.
